qas.question: What is official language of Egypt?
What are main laguages of immigrants?
In the 19th century, what city of Egypt was a large community of Italian Egyptians?
What are the three most spoken languages in Egypt?

answers.text: Egyptian Arabic (68%), Sa'idi Arabic (29%), Eastern Egyptian Bedawi Arabic (1.6%)

context: The official language of the Republic is <a0_0>Modern Standard Arabic<a0_0/>. Arabic was adopted by the Egyptians after the Arab invasion of Egypt. The spoken languages are: <a3_0>Egyptian Arabic (68%), Sa'idi Arabic (29%), Eastern Egyptian Bedawi Arabic (1.6%)<a3_0/>, Sudanese Arabic (0.6%), Domari (0.3%), Nobiin (0.3%), Beja (0.1%), Siwi and others. Additionally, <a1_0>Greek, Armenian and Italian<a1_0/> are the main languages of immigrants. In <a2_0>Alexandria<a2_0/> in the 19th century there was a large community of Italian Egyptians and Italian was the "lingua franca" of the city.
